TAM.description_of_public: The total addressable market includes all motorcycle owners and enthusiasts who could potentially purchase accessory bundles. This encompasses both end customers who own motorcycles and dealers who sell motorcycle accessories. The market is driven by the growing popularity of motorcycles as a mode of transport and leisure activity.
TAM.justification: The TAM was calculated based on current motorcycle ownership statistics, projected growth in motorcycle sales, and the increasing demand for accessories. Assumptions include a 5% growth in motorcycle ownership annually, reflecting trends in urban mobility and recreational riding. The estimated cost of accessories per motorcycle owner is calculated to be approximately €1,000, leading to a market size of €20 billion in 2024, growing to €26 billion by 2030. This reflects the increasing trend of personalization and customization in the motorcycle market.

industry_example.name: Harley-Davidson
industry_example.description: Harley-Davidson has a strong presence in the motorcycle accessory market, offering a wide range of accessories and customizations, which contributes significantly to their overall revenue.

SAM.description_of_public: The serviceable available market focuses on the segment of motorcycle owners who are likely to purchase bundles from BMW and its dealers. This includes existing BMW motorcycle owners and potential buyers who prefer BMW products due to brand loyalty and perceived quality.
SAM.justification: The SAM is estimated to be approximately 30% of the TAM based on market share analysis of BMW motorcycles, which accounts for around 15% of the global motorcycle market. The growth rate is projected at 5% annually, reflecting increasing brand loyalty and new model releases. The average spend on BMW accessories is assumed to be higher due to the premium nature of the brand, leading to substantial revenue potential from this segment.

industry_example.name: BMW Motorrad
industry_example.description: BMW Motorrad focuses on providing a wide range of motorcycle accessories and has been successful in increasing its market share through effective marketing and customer engagement strategies.

SOM.description_of_public: The serviceable obtainable market represents the realistic share of the market that BMW can capture in the near term through effective marketing and streamlined sales processes. This includes targeted customers who are actively seeking accessories and those influenced by promotions.
SOM.justification: The SOM is estimated at 20% of the SAM, reflecting realistic market capture given current brand presence and dealer network effectiveness. The anticipated growth is projected at 5% per year as BMW enhances the ordering process and increases awareness of accessory bundles. This growth assumes successful marketing strategies and customer engagement that improve the purchasing experience for both dealers and end customers.

industry_example.name: Ducati
industry_example.description: Ducati has successfully captured a significant portion of the motorcycle accessory market through targeted promotions and a focus on customer service, leading to increased sales and brand loyalty.
